DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the Emotional Well-Being scale of the FACT-Brain questionnaire, a 50-item instrument that assesses general physical,  social, emotional and functional well-being, as well as brain  tumor-specific concerns.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Outcome from the Functional Assessment of Chronic Therapy-Brain (FACT-Br) questionnaire's Emotional Well-Being scale.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
A 50-item instrument that assesses general physical,
social, emotional and functional well-being, as well as brain
tumor-specific concerns.

Concepts.definition: A 50-item instrument that assesses general physical, social, emotional and functional well-being, as well as brain tumor-specific concerns.

Property.preferredDefinition: Excessively affected by emotion.:The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease.:an ordered reference standard.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the Emotional Well-Being scale of the FACT-Brain questionnaire, a 50-item instrument that assesses general physical,  social, emotional and functional well-being, as well as brain  tumor-specific concerns.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition:
A 50-item instrument that assesses general physical,
social, emotional and functional well-being, as well as brain
tumor-specific concerns.:That aspect of consciousness devoted to affect or feeling; a strong feeling, aroused mental state, or intense state of drive or unrest directed toward a definite object, with physiological, somatic, and behavioral components.:The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A 50-item instrument that assesses general physical, social, emotional and functional well-being, as well as brain tumor-specific concerns.

That aspect of consciousness devoted to affect or feeling; a strong feeling, aroused mental state, or intense state of drive or unrest directed toward a definite object, with physiological, somatic, and behavioral components.

Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for Duke study in Rave and C3D.
